paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant V30M, including penetrance data and patient demographics.

patients.phenotype: Hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis with peripheral neuropathy (ATTRv-PN)

functional_data.summary: TTR V30M mutation leads to protein misfolding and amyloid deposition, causing peripheral neuropathy.

variants.segregation_data: The V30M mutation is known to cause ATTRv-PN and is prevalent in Brazil.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation and mutation prevalence.
variants.additional_notes: All patients in the study were carriers of the V30M mutation.
key_quotes: All patients were carriers of the V30M mutation of ATTRv-PN.
The most common mutation in Brazil is V30M (p.Val30Met), which causes a peripheral neuropathy-predominant phenotype (ATTRv-PN).

extraction_metadata.notes: Only one variant (V30M) was reported in the TTR gene.
